definition: to stay for a long time
to leave (a message etc)/to retain/to stay/to remain/to keep/to preserve

sentences.english: I have to come out a blue, a moment dares not to stay a long while again, empty mountain birds' twitter fish .
sentences.chinese: 我必须走出蓝色，一刻不敢再久留，空山鸟语鱼儿欢。

sentences.english: The best fish smell when they are three days old.
sentences.chinese: 最好的鱼三天也要变臭;作客不可久留。

sentences.english: Charm still often said that a person is to stay because of the aroma.
sentences.chinese: 常常说某人韵味犹存，就是久留的香气的缘故。

sentences.english: Needless to say, I didn't stay much longer.
sentences.chinese: 不用多说，我之后当然没有久留。

sentences.english: It's a pity you can't stay longer.
And sighing said she coud not stay.
She never stays the same for long.
sentences.chinese: 她不敢久留在同一个表现。

sentences.english: I can't stay any longer, sorry.
Here we teach you special tricks that make colognes stick.
sentences.chinese: 接下来我们要教大家让香水久留不散的诀窍。

sentences.english: Taste, sweet throat, eat it down, the fragrance of oranges stay for long mouth.
sentences.chinese: 尝一尝，甘甜润喉，吃了下去，橙香久留口中。

sentences.english: Mr. Bingley will not be detained in London by them.
sentences.chinese: 彬格莱先生不会被她们久留在伦敦的。

sentences.english: I am afraid I can’t stay any longer.

definition: to return/to go back/to come back
to go on a journey/to leave
a new branch grows out of a knot (idiom); fig. side issues keep arising
to have a rest/to stay for the night/to go to bed/to sleep
to go to bed/to retire for the night
to say goodbye/to take one's leave
to report on completion of a mission/debriefing
